speaker: Martin
text: Geez, look at this stuff.  "Golden Sunset Retirement Village," "Investments for Seniors," "Willow Brook Mortuary"?  What the hell kind of list am I on?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, the good news is I don't think it's the kind of list they keep you on very long.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, ever since I turned sixty-five, all I get is geezer mail.  It's very depressing.

speaker: Daphne
text: If you ask me, the only thing depressing about being a geezer is looking like one.  There's lots of things a person can do to make himself look younger.  How he dresses...

speaker: Martin
text: Nah, I tried those Jordache jeans.  I just think you oughta leave somethin' to the imagination.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, there's always your hair.  I know it's not exactly your style, but there's nothing wrong with covering up that gray. [_Martin makes a face._] I know just the right shade for you: cinnamon sable.

speaker: Martin
text: [_thoughtfully_] Cinnamon sable, huh?  Sounds nice.  Oh wait!  I couldn't use that, it's Duke's shade.  He'd scratch my eyes out. _The doorbell rings.  CUT TO: the living room as Frasier answers it.  It is Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_holding up a folder_] Frasier, prepare to salivate!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, if that is a picture of your new Biedermeier loveseat, you've already shown it to me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pulling out a photo_] No, this is a photo of my latest purchase: an exquisite, eighteenth-century Turkish prayer rug.  Paid a fortune for it, but legend says whatever you pray for on this rug will come to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly worked for the dealer.  Oh, I'm sorry Niles, I'm just not in the best of moods.  I just had another disastrous blind date today.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean, murderers on death row can find women to marry them!  I can't find one to sit through coffee!

speaker: Niles
text: It's easy for those men to attract women, they have all that time to work out in the yard.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm serious.  I'm getting desperate here.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't obsess about this.  My love life's not much better than yours, but you don't see me going off the deep end.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really.  Did it ever occur to you that this recent antique buying binge you've been on is nothing but a way of sublimating your frustrated sexual desires?

speaker: Niles
text: That's preposterous!  These purchases have nothing to do with sex.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't they?  In addition to the loveseat, let's see, your most recent acquisitions have been: a French bed- warmer... a pair of Toby jugs... the less said about that Civil War ramrod, the better.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you Freudians!  Sometimes a ramrod is just a... oh hell, even I can't make that one fly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Take heart, Niles.  We're both in the same boat. The hard part is, where do you go to meet people?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's not that hard.  Just yesterday I met a very nice man at the grocery.  We got to talking, and he asked me if I was free Saturday night.  I said, "Yes." He said, "Oh, wait, that's my niece's bat mitzvah." I said, "I've never been to a bat mitzvah."  He said, "Would you like to go to the bat mitzvah?"  I said, "Oh, yes.  I'd love to go to the bat mitzvah."  So he said...

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, nothing, I'm sorry.  Go on.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hmm... Oh, I seem to have lost my train of thought. Oh, well.  Anyone like some tea?

speaker: Both
text: Oh, love some/Thank you, yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: A little trick I discovered a few weeks ago, it's a lifesaver.  Anyway, as I was saying, where does one go to meet available women?

speaker: Niles
text: There are singles bars, of course.  Uh, we could join a health club.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, there's a splendid idea.  Yes, I can just picture the two of us: tank tops and spandex.  Find us a pair of matching headbands, we might as well just sterilize ourselves!

speaker: Martin
text: [_coming from the kitchen_] Wow, sounds like fun, Daph. [_muttering_] If she says "bat mitzvah" one more time... Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey Dad. [_to Frasier_] Well, if you're so smart, you come up with an idea.

speaker: Martin
text: What're you guys talkin' about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just our pathetic love lives.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, why don't you do what my buddies and I used to do when we were young and hard up for dates?

speaker: Frasier
text: Invade Korea? [_Niles bursts out laughing._]

speaker: Martin
text: No, we threw a party.  With just one rule: only single, available people were invited.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, Dad.  That doesn't really sound like us.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know, it works.  I used to throw one a month.  People used to call them Marty Parties.  People would call me up and say, "Hey, Marty, when's the next Marty Party?"  "Isn't it about time for another Marty Party?"  "Sure had a great time at that last Marty Party!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry, nothing.

speaker: Martin
text: Or somebody might say, "Can I host the next Marty Party?"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] It doesn't always work.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.  Thanks Dad, but I don't think we're really quite hard-up enough yet to stage a singles party.

speaker: Martin
text: OK, suit yourself.  Well, we'll just get ready for the evening.  I'll dish out the spaghetti and you guys set up the card table. [_tone becomes starker_] I got us a new jigsaw puzzle.  Ten thousand pieces.  It's called "The Wheat Field."

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll send the invitations.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll call the caterer.  **DOES HE OR DOESN'T HE?** _Scene 2 - Niles Apartment at the Montana Fade in.  The apartment is full of people, all mingling and having a good time.  The doorbell rings, Niles answers it and greets two ladies._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, welcome, please come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is wonderful.  I had no idea we'd get such a turnout.

speaker: Niles
text: I know!  Everywhere I look, there's another woman I want to get to know better.

speaker: Niles
text: With some obvious exceptions. [_He walks off._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I didn't know you were coming.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, I know it's a long shot, but I figured I better get out and do a little flirting, before I forget how.

speaker: Waiter
text: Can I offer you something? _Roz simply grins like a goof and splutters until the waiter goes away and then buries her face in her hand._

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, Roz, you _are_ rusty.

speaker: Roz
text: By the way, I know you've been striking out a lot lately, but I invited someone tonight guaranteed to improve your batting average.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not necessary, Roz.  I've already met someone quite captivating...

speaker: Tina
text: Hi, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Tina, you made it.

speaker: Tina
text: Oh, you know me.  Have I ever said 'No' to a good time?

speaker: Roz
text: That's what I was trying to tell Frasier.  Tina Cramer, meet Dr. Frasier Crane. [_They shake._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Tina
text: Doctor, huh? [_Roz walks away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's right.  Roz?  Roz?

speaker: Tina
text: Ooh, strong hands.  I guess it's true what they say: strong hands, strong mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, that's why you'll never see an unopened pickle jar at a Mensa meeting.

speaker: Tina
text: Huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me.  Oh, excuse me. _The last man she bumped into turns around.  It is Martin with a horrible dye job._

speaker: Roz
text: Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: You're lookin' at my hair, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, yeah.  Looks great.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks.  I did it myself.

speaker: Roz
text: Get out.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, really.  Well, Daphne suggested it, and at first I said, "No way," but then I thought well, you know, a lot of other guys do it, and what better place to try it than here, where nobody knows who I am?  Boy, you look great, too.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thanks.  Yeah, I was really happy with this dress. You can't even tell I'm pregnant in it.

speaker: Martin
text: I know.  I mean, it's just... Well, you have a great time at the party, the dress looks great, nobody'd know.

speaker: Roz
text: Same with your hair, looks completely natural.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks.  _They separate, each with a look of "Who do they think they're fooling?" on their face.  Martin walks over to Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey watch that "Dad" business.  I've got a few young ladies around here thinking I just might be your brother.

speaker: Niles
text: [_deadpan_] Yeah, it's like looking in a mirror.

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter, aren't you having any fun?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sort of.  It's just been so long since I've been single, I'm finding it hard to strike up conversations.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, now, it's nothing.  You just need a little confidence.  Here, watch this.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi there.

speaker: Vickie
text: Hi.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm Marty Crane, and this is my son Niles.  Yep, my son.

speaker: Vickie
text: Hi, Vickie Cantrell.  You're the host.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Vickie
text: I was just admiring your beautiful Turkish rug.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you!

speaker: Vickie
text: Is that eighteenth century?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it is.  You have quite an eye.

speaker: Vickie
text: Well, I work for an auction house.  I would love to see some of your other pieces.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, It would be my pleasure.  You know there's an absurd old legend about that rug that whatever you pray for... [_As they walk along, Vickie puts her arm in his._] Well, perhaps it's not that absurd after all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!  Roz, that woman is all over me.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, of course she is!  Didn't you get what I was trying to tell ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes of course I got it!  I also got it when she showed me how she can tie a knot in a cherry stem with her tongue.

speaker: Roz
text: That's a party trick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Except the cherry was in my mouth at the time!  Roz, I already tried to tell you that I've met a woman tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: All right.  I'll go talk to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_Roz walks off, Niles comes up._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so glad we had this party!  I just met the most fabulous woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh that's fabulous.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to bartender_] Two white wines.

speaker: Frasier
text: I also met someone who's terrific.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait, wait.  I can't wait.  I have to show you mine first.  She's over by the buffet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, so's mine.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, let me ask you something:  At what point would you like to acknowledge that we're both waving to the same woman? [_He spins around._] I saw her first!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not fair!  You're the host, you see everyone first!

speaker: Niles
text: There are plenty of other women here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly, so go pick one!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, let's just stop this.  The only civilized thing to do is for us to both stay away from her.  We are psychiatrists, not a couple of rutting pigs in a barnyard.  What do you say to that? _They look back at Vickie who has just taken off her wrap, revealing bare shoulders and a clinging dress._

speaker: Frasier
text: Soo-eee.

speaker: Niles
text: Very well, may the better man win.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, your father wants you.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, advantage Niles! [_He grabs the wine and heads off._] _Frasier walks over to Martin, who is sitting with a woman in the chairs by the fire._

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: I want you to meet a big fan of yours.  Kathy Lockher, this is my son, Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Kathy
text: I was just telling your father how much I love your show.  You're such a good listener.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Kathy
text: Just yesterday, you gave the best advice to that woman who called in with a problem about her teenage son. What was it you said, exactly?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_watching Niles and Vickie_] Oh, what do I ever say? You're in denial, seek help, whatever, blah, blah, blah. [_He walks away._]

speaker: Kathy
text: He's a little different from what I expected.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's not what I expected either, but you get used to it.

speaker: Kathy
text: So, you were telling me about being a detective.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, yeah, I... say, do you ah, feel like getting a drink?

speaker: Kathy
text: Yeah, that'd be nice, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: OK, let's go. _He starts to get up but notices that his hair has left a large stain on the back of the chair.  He hurriedly sits back down._

speaker: Martin
text: You know, this is such a prime spot here, I think one of us should stay here and one of us should get the drinks.

speaker: Kathy
text: You're right.

speaker: Martin
text: So, I'll have a beer.

speaker: Kathy
text: [_unsure_] OK. [_She gets up._] Oh, shoot, I think I lost an earring.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, oh, there it is, by my foot. [_Kathy looks expectantly at him.  He flicks the earring to her with his foot._] There you go.

speaker: Kathy
text: Thanks.  Enjoy the party.

speaker: Kathy
text: These eggrolls are delicious.

speaker: Niles
text: I, uh, made them myself.

speaker: Kathy
text: Really, a psychiatrist and a chef?  Impressive.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well they both came in handy when I cured the ham.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: What do you want?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, there's something of an emergency in the kitchen.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's very cadgy, Frasier.  Why don't you just run out and yell "Fire?" _Frasier motions towards the kitchen.  The door is open, smoke is coming out, and a caterer is waving Niles over while mouthing the word "Fire."_

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God.  Excuse me, Vickie, for just for a moment.

speaker: Vickie
text: Of course. _Niles runs to the kitchen, holding his hands down and moving stiffly._

speaker: Vickie
text: Is it a serious problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.  He's always run like that.  Oh, oh you mean the kitchen.  No, no, Niles can handle it.

speaker: Vickie
text: You two seem very close.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  I'm his best friend.  Well, his only friend really.

speaker: Vickie
text: Well that surprises me.  He seems very outgoing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Doesn't he, though?  Yes, the medication seems to be working wonders.  Just hope he sticks with it this time. Well, shall we hit the buffet? _CUT TO: Roz sitting at one end of the fainting couch and talking to a young man._

speaker: Roz
text: What a great story.

speaker: Man
text: Thanks, this is fun.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Man
text: I usually hate these kinds of parties.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, me too. People are always so superficial.

speaker: Man
text: Yeah, seems like everybody nowadays is all about appearances.  Well, shall we get a drink?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, sure. _Roz stands up and the man steps down from the landing.  He is a head shorter than her and stares at her stomach.  They freeze._

speaker: Roz
text: I'm not really very thirsty.

speaker: Man
text: Me either.

speaker: Roz
text: OK.

speaker: Man
text: See ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then I top it all off with brandied cherries and a dollop of creme fraiche.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not now Niles.  I'm telling Vickie my recipe for crepes cateau.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sure she's had enough of your crepes by now. I'm terribly sorry to interrupt, but I believe Dad needs you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, he doesn't.

speaker: Vickie
text: Oh, I think he might. [_Martin is frantically waving at Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, then.  If you will excuse me.

speaker: Vickie
text: Do you live with your father, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] Oh, no.  A grown man, live with his father? Frasier lives with Dad.  Champagne?

speaker: Vickie
text: Oh, yes. _CUT TO: Frasier talking to Martin again.  Martin has something dripping down his forehead._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is it?

speaker: Martin
text: You gotta get me home!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, something's happening with my hair dye.  It's melting or somethin'.  Look at this stain! [_indicating chair, not his head_] It must look terrible.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no it doesn't actually.  It looks terrific.

speaker: Martin
text: You sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe the fire is making you perspire just a little bit.  Here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually you look quite young and attractive.  You know by the warmth of the fire glow, I'd say that you actually look like you're back in your Marty Party days.

speaker: Martin
text: You're not BSing me?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.

speaker: Martin
text: OK, then, I'll stay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great!

speaker: Frasier
text: Vickie.  Hello, where's Niles?

speaker: Vickie
text: Oh, he had to take a call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, that's terrific.  Ah, would you be interested in maybe finding some place where we could talk, just the two of us, no interruptions?

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not now, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Come here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can't you see I'm busy?

speaker: Roz
text: My water just broke!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... maybe you sat in something.

speaker: Niles
text: [_hollering from a corner_] Oh my God, what's all over my Turkish prayer rug?!

speaker: Roz
text: You gotta get me to a hospital.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I'm sorry, of course.  Vickie, Vickie?  If you'll excuse us, my friend Roz just went into labor.

speaker: Vickie
text: Oh, how exciting!  Good luck.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wait, wait just one second.  Vickie, I know this may not be the most appropriate moment, but I was wondering if perhaps you'd like to have dinner with me sometime.

speaker: Vickie
text: Oh, well, that's very sweet of you, Frasier, but I'm not really interested.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, thank you for your honesty. [_to Roz_] My God! What is wrong with me?  Why can't I find a single woman who's interested in me?

speaker: Roz
text: Those are two different questions, really, so we should just sit down and talk them both over.  Oh, wait, I can't - BECAUSE I'M IN LABOR!!  _They rush out the door.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - The Hospital Fade in.  Frasier and Martin are at the vending machines in the waiting area._

speaker: Frasier
text: How's the coffee, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Better.  This time it's hot and it's got extra cream. Of course, it's still chicken soup. _He throws the cup away.  They go over to the chairs and Martin sits._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, who needs coffee when we can keep alert by perusing these very up-to-date magazines? [_picks one up_] Oh, look, Dad.  That cute Tricia Nixon's getting married.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, excuse me?  May we get an update on Roz Doyle?

speaker: Nurse
text: Sure. [_checks her clipboard_] Uh, she is still in early labor.  Hang in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: She's pretty.  I should make a play for her -- considering how young and attractive I am tonight!

speaker: Frasier
text: I said I was sorry!  Not half as sorry as I was when I went over that speed bump and you left a head print on the ceiling of my BMW.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.  Didn't expect to see you here.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, the doorman found Roz's purse in the lobby. I thought she might need it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose you also came to gloat.  You got Vickie, I didn't.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting down between them_] Neither of us got Vickie. She went home with the bartender.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, you know what I say?  Her loss.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely right.  Her loss! [_pause_] Has saying that ever made you feel any better?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not a whit.

speaker: Martin
text: It's been a hell of a night for all of us.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it certainly was for me.  I lost Vickie, my rug is ruined, someone left weird brown stains on my wing chair...

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I came down as soon as I heard. [_She notices Martin._] What the hell happened to your hair?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what do you think?  I colored it, just like you told me to.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but this isn't cinnamon sable.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I couldn't use that, it had a woman's picture on the box.  So I used some stuff called "Color In A Can" instead.  It said "As seen on TV - Just spray on and go."  How did I know it was a lousy product?

speaker: Frasier
text: If only there had been some clue!

speaker: Martin
text: Don't you start on me, mister, you left me melting by that fire.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait a minute!  You're the one who left stains on my wing chair!

speaker: Frasier
text: I was wondering when you'd crack that, Miss Marple!

speaker: Daphne
text: Stop it!  What is wrong with the three of you?!  Our friend is having a baby in there!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Daphne, we've all had dreadful evenings, but you're absolutely right.  We should be thinking of Roz. [_They all sit._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Exactly.  Besides, nobody could've had as horrendous an evening as I did.  I got stood up.  At a bat mitzvah! I waited there an hour.  Oh, he left some lame excuse on the machine, but if he thinks he's got another chance with me, he's _meshugge_.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, boo-hoo, anyway.  At least you had a date tonight!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, at least your apartment wasn't decimated!

speaker: Martin
text: I went to a party tonight with shoe polish on my hair!  _Four-way bickering ensues.  Then Roz is pushed in a bed around the corner, breathing heavily._

speaker: Nurse
text: That's it, breathe.  You're doing great. _The four friends stop and begin calling words of encouragement to Roz. "You're doing great!"  "Hang in there!"  "We love you."  As soon as the bed is pushed into a room, they begin fighting again.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Roz's Room Fade in.  The nurse comes in and holds the door for the others._

speaker: Nurse
text: She's very tired, so I'll have to ask you to make it quick.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK. _The four of them enter.  Roz is sitting up in bed, exhausted and drenched in sweat - but radiant.  Sleeping in her arms is a beautiful baby girl.  Everyone whispering:_

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz.  Congratulations.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, look at her!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, she's beautiful.

speaker: Daphne
text: _Mazel tov_!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a long story.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, what's her name?

speaker: Roz
text: Alice.  Alice May Doyle.  My daughter.  My God, it's the first time I've ever said that.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you look great.  How do you feel?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, fine.  Just a little tired.

speaker: Martin
text: Sure.

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe we should go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll drop by and see you tomorrow, OK?

speaker: Roz
text: OK.

speaker: Martin
text: [_reaching out_] You know, I sure would love to hold her for just a second?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_intercepting and taking Alice_] You know, maybe we should just wait until you're not dripping toxins.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  OK, we'll see you, then.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll be along in a second.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz.  Congratulations again.  I'm so proud of you. Your little girl is just perfect.

speaker: Roz
text: [_strokes Alice's head_] She is, isn't she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm.  My God, look at your face.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah, I must look real lovely.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's exactly how you look: lovely.  I don't think I've ever seen your face more purely happy than right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, little Alice, how I wish you could wake up right now and see how beautiful your mother looks. [_Roz is now dead asleep, head thrown back and snoring._] Then again, you need your rest. _He puts the baby in her little bed.  The nurse comes in behind him._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sotto voce_] You did great, honey. [_He kisses her on the forehead_] Sleep well. [_He turns and notices the nurse._] Oh, hello.

speaker: Nurse
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: This may seem like an odd time to ask you this, but I was convinced that we sort of made some eye contact in the waiting room and I was wondering if I could get your number.

speaker: Nurse
text: [_thinking Roz is his wife_] What about your...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, forget about her, she's asleep.

speaker: Nurse
text: What kind of monster are you?! [_She leaves in a huff._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Her loss.  _FADE OUT.  End of Act 2_
